page.title: 14EDUCATION IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: Education is of long standing in the Kirkby Lonsdale area.In 1591 a small, free grammar school,called{Queen {Elizabeth School,}was founded on Mill Brow for local boys.In 1846,after many fluctuations in its fortunes,it moved to its present site at Springfield House.From 1978 it changed from a grammar into a comprehensive school and by 1985 is fully{comprehensive.}It contains 650 boys and girls between the ages of 11 and 19.These pupils come from Kirkby and other surrounding villages,as well as having places for 80 boarders from other areas.The{C of {E's National School}was built in the 1850s and now is overcrowded due to the closure of the primary schools at Lupton and Barbon.Building started on a new primary school in 1985 opposite Queen Elizabeth School and will be opened in 1986.
